title: I need to serve fl160. Do I need to file form with court? If so, which form?
question: It's completed fl160. I also want to know if this un-do default status? I was advised before that fl160 is exception & I can make changes after the petition...
answers: If you are seeking a default judgment, you need to file and serve your FL-160. It gets filed with the Court with your Default Judgment package if you are seeking orders relating to the award and/or division of property or debts. If you are the Petitioner, it will not undo default status. Your question is too cryptic to enable me to respond further - you should go to your Court's Self-Help Clinic for advice and assistance from a volunteer lawyer if you can't afford a consultation with an experienced Family Law Attorney, although you likely know that you get what you pay for.
